headline: Everything is Magical in 'Wicked', Even the Fashion!
content: Costume designer Paul Tazewell weaved his magic for ‚ÄòWicked,‚Äô here's how he breathed life into the costume design. When it comes to the world ofWicked, the costumes are just as magical as the story itself. Costume designer Paul Tazewell, known for his meticulous attention to detail, has crafted costumes that not only define the characters of Elphaba and Glinda but also contribute to the world-building of Oz. His journey into the world ofWickedwas shaped by a French picture book, which inspired him to create a visual world where every scene is as captivating as the last, down to the smallest details. Tazewell‚Äôs designs breathe life into the characters, giving depth and backstory through the clothes they wear.  Tracy Nguyen for The New York Times Elphaba‚Äôs earth-toned, textured wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs glamorous, show-stopping dresses aren‚Äôt just about fabric‚Äîthey‚Äôre about storytelling. From the iconic pink bubble dress, a design requiring 137 pattern pieces and over 200 hours of hand-beading, to the intricately felted details of Elphaba's costume, every stitch is a part of a bigger narrative. Paul Tazewell brings more than three decades of experience in costume design, with accolades ranging from Broadway hits likeHamiltonandIn the Heightsto his film work onHarrietandWest Side Story. But it was his approach toWickedthat allowed him to blend his deep love of detail with a fresh, modern interpretation.  Paul Tazewell has spent more than 30 years designing costumes for theater. Image: Instyle Tazewell wanted the costumes to speak to a more expansive, reimagined version of the world of Oz, one that still felt grounded in its theatrical history but also distinctly his own. His meticulous work not only pays homage to the original Broadway costumes designed by Susan Hilferty but also reinterprets them to suit the needs of the film, ensuring the costumes fit perfectly into the cinematic version of this beloved tale. His work with the color palettes of Elphaba‚Äôs darker, nature-inspired wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs lighter, airy look shows the evolution of their characters and their relationship. As Elphaba begins to find herself and grow more comfortable with her own power, her clothes shift from restrictive, turn-of-the-century shapes to more modern, freeing silhouettes.  Cynthia Erivo's costumes as Elphaba featured textural elements that were inspired by nature. Image: Universal Glinda‚Äôs journey also plays out through her fashion‚Äîher early, overly feminine looks evolve as her bond with Elphaba deepens, resulting in a blending of both characters' visual identities.  The bodice of Glinda's (played by Ariana Grande) bubble gown took 225 hours to hand-bead. Image: Universal Tazewell‚Äôs passion for detail extends beyond just the characters. The costumes, made by an extensive team of artisans, serve as an immersive experience that captures every nuance ofWicked's world. With over 60 costumes per lead character and a total of 140 crew members working across eight different workshops, Tazewell's vision comes to life in ways that are both stunning and intricate. His ability to weave the characters' emotional arcs into their clothing and his understanding of how the designs would resonate with the audience is what makes his work so remarkable.  The costumes for Madame Morrible (Michelle Yeoh) featured magical iconography. Image: Universal The film‚Äôs approach toWickedisn‚Äôt about just re-creating past designs; it‚Äôs about evolving them into something new while retaining the magic that has made the characters so iconic. The challenge of blending the theatrical elements with the expansive world of film is one Tazewell embraces with confidence, bringing his creative vision to the forefront in a way that enhances the storytelling. Ultimately, Tazewell's work onWickedis about more than just creating beautiful costumes‚Äîit's about ensuring that every detail, from fabric to silhouette, adds to the narrative, bringing each character‚Äôs journey to life in the most magical way possible. The world of Oz feels alive through Tazewell‚Äôs designs, and it's a testament to his incredible talent and vision that every element ofWicked's costumes adds depth to the story. The world ofWickedfeels vast and boundless. The teamwork between Tazewell, Chu, Crowley, and everyone involved has brought to life something incredibly detailed, imaginative, rich, and exciting‚Äîso much so that you‚Äôll wish it could slow down, allowing you to fully appreciate every intricate detail, from the background characters to Jonathan Bailey‚Äôs Fiyero boots. Exactly as Tazewell envisioned. A post shared by Wicked Movie (@wickedmovie)  COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: Rebel Wilson loses bid to dismiss defamation lawsuit in ‚ÄòThe Deb‚Äô dispute
content:
US Rebel Wilson faces a lawsuit over allegations of embezzlement and harassment during the production of The Deb. Rebel Wilson's attempt to dismiss a defamation lawsuit filed by the producers of her directorial debut,The Deb, has been denied by a Los Angeles Superior Court. Judge Thomas Long ruled that the actress‚Äôs claims of sexual harassment and embezzlement, made in an Instagram video and other contexts, do not qualify as protected free speech under California‚Äôs anti-SLAPP statute. The producers, Amanda Ghost, Gregor Cameron, and Vince Holden, allege that Wilson defamed them to gain creative control and force the film's premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). Wilson had previously accused the producers of inappropriate behavior toward the film‚Äôs lead actress and embezzling approximately AU $900,000 from the budget. However, lead actress Charlotte MacInnes denied these allegations, stating in court that Wilson‚Äôs claims were baseless and made her feel bullied by the director. While Wilson countersued in October, alleging theft, bullying, and harassment by the producers, her legal team plans to appeal the recent ruling. Camille Vasquez, attorney for the producers, commended the court‚Äôs decision, calling Wilson‚Äôs dismissal motion a ‚Äúcynical attempt‚Äù to suppress valid legal claims. headline: SZA and Lizzo gossip about Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during stream, internet reacts: "this is skit lol"
content:
US SZA and Lizzo‚Äôs comments on Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during a stream sparked a wave of reactions online. On Saturday, November 23, pop stars Lizzo and SZA appeared on Kai Cenat's stream during the streamer's ongoing 24/7 Mafiathon 2 event. While the two were in the kitchen, SZA commented that Cenat seemed like a "clean person." Lizzo agreed but quickly joked that Cenat hadn't "washed his balls" in a long time. SZA, surprised by the remark, asked if it was true and wanted to know if Cenat had told Lizzo. The Juice singer explained that Cenat had been showering with his trunks on for 23 days on stream but suggested that perhaps he was still washing properly. SZA exclaimed: "His meat's been dry for 23 days? Unbelievable!" Social media users reacted strongly to the pair‚Äôs comments. Some felt that SZA and Lizzo were overreacting, with one user on X stating: "Cut the extra money of overactingü§£" Others thought the duo was fully aware they were being filmed. One user on X wrote:"ain't no way they didn't know it has camera, this is skit lol." Another added: "They definitely knew they was on camera üò©üò©." A different user joked: "SZA immediately asking 'who said that' like yes get to the bottom of it, girl üò≠üò≠üò≠." Some fans were unhappy with how Lizzo and SZA spoke about Cenat. One user commented:"Someone let you into his house and you criticize him behind his back.. That‚Äôs foul." Another added: "Really behind his backüò≠." A netizen noted: "Even druski said he‚Äôs bedroom smells like spoiled milk lmao ü§£." Another wrote: "IK HE DIRTY ASF LMAOOOOO." On Friday, November 22, Kai Cenat achieved a major milestone by reaching 500,000 concurrent Twitch subscribers. The 24/7 Mafiathon 2 stream aimed to reclaim his original record of 326,000 subscribers, which was previously broken by Vtuber Ironmouse. By the 22nd day of his marathon stream, he had completely shattered the record. COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: Jon Watts cancels Wolfs sequel after trust issues with Apple TV
content:
US Jon Watts canceled Wolfs sequel, citing Apple's surprise decision to shift from wide theatrical release to streaming. Jon Watts has revealed he scrapped plans for a sequel to Wolfs, starring George Clooney and Brad Pitt, citing a loss of trust in Apple. The director explained that the studio‚Äôs last-minute decision to shift the original film from a wide theatrical release to a limited run followed by streaming led to his decision. Watts shared with Deadline that Apple initially praised his final cut of Wolfs and even commissioned a sequel. However, he was blindsided by the pivot to streaming, learning of the change less than a week before the public announcement. ‚ÄúApple didn‚Äôt cancel the sequel‚ÄîI did‚Äîbecause I no longer trusted them as a creative partner,‚Äù Watts stated. Despite his disappointment, he returned the sequel commission to avoid generating negative press during the film‚Äôs release. Watts also expressed frustration with Apple for ignoring his request to exclude the sequel announcement from their press release. ‚ÄúThey used it to create a positive spin on their streaming decision,‚Äù he said, emphasizing that the move came without explanation or discussion. While proud of Wolfs, Watts felt compelled to take a stand for creative transparency. His experience echoes a growing trend in the industry, exemplified by Doug Liman‚Äôs Road House debacle after Amazon acquired MGM. Liman, who had anticipated a theatrical release, saw the project shifted to streaming, which directly affected compensation for him and his team. ‚ÄúWe need streaming, but agreements must be honored,‚Äù Liman said in an interview. While Watts supports streaming as a medium, his experience highlights tensions between creative expectations and shifting studio priorities. Apple has yet to comment on the matter, but Watts‚Äô principled decision underscores the importance of trust in creative partnerships. headline: Everything is Magical in 'Wicked', Even the Fashion!
content: Costume designer Paul Tazewell weaved his magic for ‚ÄòWicked,‚Äô here's how he breathed life into the costume design. When it comes to the world ofWicked, the costumes are just as magical as the story itself. Costume designer Paul Tazewell, known for his meticulous attention to detail, has crafted costumes that not only define the characters of Elphaba and Glinda but also contribute to the world-building of Oz. His journey into the world ofWickedwas shaped by a French picture book, which inspired him to create a visual world where every scene is as captivating as the last, down to the smallest details. Tazewell‚Äôs designs breathe life into the characters, giving depth and backstory through the clothes they wear.  Tracy Nguyen for The New York Times Elphaba‚Äôs earth-toned, textured wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs glamorous, show-stopping dresses aren‚Äôt just about fabric‚Äîthey‚Äôre about storytelling. From the iconic pink bubble dress, a design requiring 137 pattern pieces and over 200 hours of hand-beading, to the intricately felted details of Elphaba's costume, every stitch is a part of a bigger narrative. Paul Tazewell brings more than three decades of experience in costume design, with accolades ranging from Broadway hits likeHamiltonandIn the Heightsto his film work onHarrietandWest Side Story. But it was his approach toWickedthat allowed him to blend his deep love of detail with a fresh, modern interpretation.  Paul Tazewell has spent more than 30 years designing costumes for theater. Image: Instyle Tazewell wanted the costumes to speak to a more expansive, reimagined version of the world of Oz, one that still felt grounded in its theatrical history but also distinctly his own. His meticulous work not only pays homage to the original Broadway costumes designed by Susan Hilferty but also reinterprets them to suit the needs of the film, ensuring the costumes fit perfectly into the cinematic version of this beloved tale. His work with the color palettes of Elphaba‚Äôs darker, nature-inspired wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs lighter, airy look shows the evolution of their characters and their relationship. As Elphaba begins to find herself and grow more comfortable with her own power, her clothes shift from restrictive, turn-of-the-century shapes to more modern, freeing silhouettes.  Cynthia Erivo's costumes as Elphaba featured textural elements that were inspired by nature. Image: Universal Glinda‚Äôs journey also plays out through her fashion‚Äîher early, overly feminine looks evolve as her bond with Elphaba deepens, resulting in a blending of both characters' visual identities.  The bodice of Glinda's (played by Ariana Grande) bubble gown took 225 hours to hand-bead. Image: Universal Tazewell‚Äôs passion for detail extends beyond just the characters. The costumes, made by an extensive team of artisans, serve as an immersive experience that captures every nuance ofWicked's world. With over 60 costumes per lead character and a total of 140 crew members working across eight different workshops, Tazewell's vision comes to life in ways that are both stunning and intricate. His ability to weave the characters' emotional arcs into their clothing and his understanding of how the designs would resonate with the audience is what makes his work so remarkable.  The costumes for Madame Morrible (Michelle Yeoh) featured magical iconography. Image: Universal The film‚Äôs approach toWickedisn‚Äôt about just re-creating past designs; it‚Äôs about evolving them into something new while retaining the magic that has made the characters so iconic. The challenge of blending the theatrical elements with the expansive world of film is one Tazewell embraces with confidence, bringing his creative vision to the forefront in a way that enhances the storytelling. Ultimately, Tazewell's work onWickedis about more than just creating beautiful costumes‚Äîit's about ensuring that every detail, from fabric to silhouette, adds to the narrative, bringing each character‚Äôs journey to life in the most magical way possible. The world of Oz feels alive through Tazewell‚Äôs designs, and it's a testament to his incredible talent and vision that every element ofWicked's costumes adds depth to the story. The world ofWickedfeels vast and boundless. The teamwork between Tazewell, Chu, Crowley, and everyone involved has brought to life something incredibly detailed, imaginative, rich, and exciting‚Äîso much so that you‚Äôll wish it could slow down, allowing you to fully appreciate every intricate detail, from the background characters to Jonathan Bailey‚Äôs Fiyero boots. Exactly as Tazewell envisioned. A post shared by Wicked Movie (@wickedmovie)  COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: Jon M. Chu provides update on ‚ÄòCrazy Rich Asians‚Äô sequel and upcoming Broadway musical
content:
US Jon M. Chu reveals challenges delaying the Crazy Rich Asians sequel, while teasing a Broadway musical adaptation. Fans eagerly awaiting theCrazy Rich Asianssequel may need to hold out longer as director Jon M. Chu shared new insights into the project‚Äôs delays. In an interview withDeadline, Chu emphasized the need for the follow-up to match the high expectations set by the 2018 hit. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no way I‚Äôm dragging the audience back. The bar is too high,‚Äù he said, noting that attempts to adapt the second book from Kevin Kwan‚Äôs trilogy have yet to meet the creative standards established by the first film. Chu explained that the sequel faces unique challenges as the first movie deviated significantly from the book's plot. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve tried different versions, but we just haven‚Äôt gotten there,‚Äù he shared. While fans may not see the second movie anytime soon, Chu teased a new development‚ÄîaCrazy Rich AsiansBroadway musical, which he will direct, marking his debut in theater. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs very exciting and very fun,‚Äù Chu said, offering hope for fans who wish to revisit theCrazy Rich Asiansuniverse. In addition to the stage adaptation, aCrazy Rich Asiansspinoff film is also in development, focusing on Astrid Leong (Gemma Chan) and her rekindled romance with Charlie Wu (Harry Shum Jr.). headline: SZA and Lizzo gossip about Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during stream, internet reacts: "this is skit lol"
content:
US SZA and Lizzo‚Äôs comments on Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during a stream sparked a wave of reactions online. On Saturday, November 23, pop stars Lizzo and SZA appeared on Kai Cenat's stream during the streamer's ongoing 24/7 Mafiathon 2 event. While the two were in the kitchen, SZA commented that Cenat seemed like a "clean person." Lizzo agreed but quickly joked that Cenat hadn't "washed his balls" in a long time. SZA, surprised by the remark, asked if it was true and wanted to know if Cenat had told Lizzo. The Juice singer explained that Cenat had been showering with his trunks on for 23 days on stream but suggested that perhaps he was still washing properly. SZA exclaimed: "His meat's been dry for 23 days? Unbelievable!" Social media users reacted strongly to the pair‚Äôs comments. Some felt that SZA and Lizzo were overreacting, with one user on X stating: "Cut the extra money of overactingü§£" Others thought the duo was fully aware they were being filmed. One user on X wrote:"ain't no way they didn't know it has camera, this is skit lol." Another added: "They definitely knew they was on camera üò©üò©." A different user joked: "SZA immediately asking 'who said that' like yes get to the bottom of it, girl üò≠üò≠üò≠." Some fans were unhappy with how Lizzo and SZA spoke about Cenat. One user commented:"Someone let you into his house and you criticize him behind his back.. That‚Äôs foul." Another added: "Really behind his backüò≠." A netizen noted: "Even druski said he‚Äôs bedroom smells like spoiled milk lmao ü§£." Another wrote: "IK HE DIRTY ASF LMAOOOOO." On Friday, November 22, Kai Cenat achieved a major milestone by reaching 500,000 concurrent Twitch subscribers. The 24/7 Mafiathon 2 stream aimed to reclaim his original record of 326,000 subscribers, which was previously broken by Vtuber Ironmouse. By the 22nd day of his marathon stream, he had completely shattered the record. COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: Glen Powell hosts lookalike contest in Austin with unique prize for winner's family member
content:
PK Glen Powell‚Äôs Austin lookalike contest featured a creative twist: a movie cameo for the winner's parent or relative. Glen Powell‚Äôs lookalike contest in Austin, Texas, on November 24, was as creative as the actor himself. The winner didn‚Äôt just receive bragging rights but was promised a cameo for their parent or family member in Powell‚Äôs upcoming film‚Äîa prize as unique as the event. Held at Auditorium Shores in Town Lake, the contest drew dozens of Powell‚Äôs lookalikes, but the actor couldn‚Äôt attend in person due to filming commitments in England for The Running Man. Despite his absence, Powell made his presence felt through a Facetime appearance, where he delivered a humorous video message packed with jokes and playful remarks. In his lighthearted video, Powell quipped that the contest was actually for This Is Us actor Justin Hartley‚Äôs lookalike and teased attendees about forming a ‚Äúcriminal Glen-Terprise‚Äù heist. ‚ÄúAnd we don‚Äôt need masks because we all have the same face: It‚Äôs the perfect crime,‚Äù he joked. He also challenged participants to fully commit to the bit, saying, ‚ÄúIf no one is shirtless for no reason, then this whole thing is a sham.‚Äù While his mother and aunt assisted in judging the contest, Powell ensured the highlight was his promise to the winner. He cheekily valued the prize at ‚Äú$6 billion,‚Äù adding, ‚ÄúThe winner‚Äôs parent or family member will have a cameo in my next movie.‚Äù Celebrity lookalike contests have grown in popularity, with similar events held for stars like Timoth√©e Chalamet and Harry Styles. However, Powell‚Äôs mix of humor and a quirky, heartfelt prize sets his event apart, showcasing his creative approach to engaging with fans‚Äîeven from thousands of miles away. headline: Diddy smiles and blows kisses to family during court bail hearing
content:
US Diddy appeared optimistic at a New York City bail hearing as he sought release amid sex trafficking charges. Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs appeared upbeat as he entered a New York City courtroom for a bail hearing, hoping to secure his release while facing charges of sex trafficking and racketeering. The 55-year-old music mogul greeted his family with blown kisses and waves as he entered South Manhattan Federal Court, wearing a beige prison jumpsuit. Unlike previous hearings, he was not shackled and was escorted by US marshals. Family and supporters, including his mother Janice Combs, daughter Chance Combs, son Justin Dior Combs, and adopted son Quincy Brown, attended the hearing on Friday afternoon. The judge deferred the decision on granting him bail, following arguments from prosecutors that Combs could not be ‚Äútrusted‚Äù to follow conditions and might evade legal supervision even with his lawyers‚Äô guidance. Combs is currently detained on a $50 million bond at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York, as he awaits his trial. During the hearing, Combs‚Äô legal team pointed to changed circumstances, including new evidence, as reasons to release him, arguing it would allow him to better prepare for his trial scheduled for May 5. Previously, two judges have ruled that he poses a danger to the community and is a flight risk. Assistant US Attorney Christine Slavik stated that Combs‚Äô attempts to contact witnesses from prison, often through family members, demonstrated that he ‚Äúcannot and will not follow rules‚Äù set by his own legal team. ‚ÄúSimply put, the defendant cannot be trusted,‚Äù she said. Slavik further accused Combs‚Äô lawyers of ‚Äúenabling his flouting of rules‚Äù and argued that they had shown an ‚Äúinability to control their client.‚Äù Last week, prosecutors alleged that Combs used jailmates‚Äô phones to intimidate potential witnesses ahead of his trial. According to court documents, he allegedly contacted family members from prison, asking them to reach out to potential victims and craft ‚Äúnarratives‚Äù while making ‚Äúrelentless efforts‚Äù to ‚Äúcorruptly influence witness testimony.‚Äù COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: PTI convoys face tear gas as march towards Islamabad continues
content:
US PTI Chairman Barrister Gohar says talks are underway. PTI convoys led by Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (K-P) Chief Minister Ali Amin Gandapur and Opposition leader, Omar Ayub, entered Punjab premises on the call of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf founder Imran Khan. The convoys, originating from the Hazara Interchange, are heading towards D-Chowk in Islamabad. As the convoys advanced, they encountered heavy resistance from the police at the Ghazi Brotha Bridge, where intense shelling was reported. Despite the police crackdown, Omar Ayub's convoy managed to push back Punjab Police forces at the Hazara Interchange. Ali Amin Gandapur, who is leading the Hazara Division convoy, played a crucial role in helping the convoy break through the police barricades. After overcoming the police blockade, the convoys continued their journey, with vehicles stretching over two kilometers as they moved forward. On the Hazara Motorway, PTI supporters successfully forced police to retreat, with reports of violent clashes and heavy stone-pelting. Several police personnel were injured in the scuffles, and two officers were severely wounded and transferred to hospitals. Among the injured officers were DSPs Chaudhry Zulfiqar and Shahid Gilani, as well as ASI Tabassum. DSP Zulfiqar suffered significant injuries to his back and legs during the confrontation. 'Talks underway' Barrister Gohar Khan and Saif held a 90-minute meeting with Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan in Adiala Jail, Rawalpindi. Following the meeting, Barrister Gohar described the discussion as significant, confirming that Imran Khan‚Äôs call for a protest remains final and that rumors about it being canceled were untrue. Speaking to journalists after the meeting, Barrister Gohar emphasised that the PTI founder‚Äôs stance on the protest was unchanged, and the movement would proceed as planned. The meeting focused on strategic discussions regarding the ongoing political situation and the party's future course of action. When asked about the ongoing negotiations surrounding the protest, Barrister Gohar assured reporters that updates would be provided in due course. He further confirmed that discussions were still ongoing but did not offer further details at this time. 'Final call' The PTI gave its final call for the protest to meet its four demands: release of all political prisoners, including Imran Khan, reversal of the 26th Constitutional Amendment, restoration of democracy and Constitution in the country and return of allegedly "stolen mandate". The demands surfaced on November 13 after Imran had urged people via a post on X, formerly Twitter, to reach Islamabad and not to return until those were met. The PTI had said that its rallies would be converted into a sit-in in the federal capital and end only when the demands were met. Since then, the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N)-led government, backed by a recent order of the Islamabad High Court (IHC), has been stating that neither the protestors would be allowed to enter the capital nor any leniency would be shown to them this time around. In anticipation of a possible head-on collision between the authorities and the protesters and in view of the visit by Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko, the government decided to place containers to block all the main arteries leading to Islamabad. The blockade has brought the twin cities as well as several other cities in Punjab to a standstill. A surprising decision was the sudden beginning of the repair work on different motorways. Besides, the government also shut down the internet in several areas. Internet services suspension The interior ministry had already announced a day ago that WiFi and mobile internet services would be suspended in areas with "security concerns" but it would remain operational in the rest of the country. Nevertheless, internet tracking monitor Netblocks said WhatsApp backends were restricted in Pakistan. The decision was part of the government's strategy to block communication ahead of the planned protests. Amid this, both sides remained steadfast, refusing to back down until achieving their objectives. Before the march began, the federal and Punjab governments imposed Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC)¬óa legal measure enabling district administrations to ban public gatherings temporarily and denied PTI permission to hold the protest. Nevertheless, PTI took to the streets, with Gandapur leading the march from the party's stronghold in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa, joined by the provincial leadership, workers, supporters, and Imran Khan's wife, Bushra Bibi. Though the caravans had entered Punjab, they were unlikely to reach Islamabad by Sunday night. In a brief address to workers in Swabi, Gandapur urged them to press forward and not retreat until Imran Khan's release, calling on protesters to use all their strength to clear the path to the federal capital. As the PTI convoy reached the Punjab boundary, the police started shelling on them at the Attock Bridge, Chach interchange and Ghazi Barotha canal areas. Later, Gandapur directed the convoy to stop at Ghazi Maqam for a while, urging the workers to get ready, because there was a "battle ahead". Meanwhile, it was reported that Imran Khan's wife, Bushra Bibi, also addressed the workers and asked them to quickly move ahead in their vehicles instead of walking along the march, stressing they would have to move fast and shouldn't come back without bringing Imran Khan back. While the K-P saw the largest mobilisation of the participants, the rallies also set out from various parts of Punjab, Sindh, and Balochistan. In Punjab, opposition supporters marched from cities, including Lahore, Rawalpindi, Gujranwala, Sialkot, Mianwali, Kasur, Okara, and Vehari, among others. Despite heavy police and Rangers' deployment, many PTI workers managed to breach barricades and evade restrictions, in an attempt to reach the capital. Throughout the day, the PTI workers and LEA officials kept clashing in different parts of Punjab. Several leaders arrested A media report suggested that several PTI leaders, including PTI's chief whip in the National Assembly Amir Dogar and Zain Qureshi were arrested from Multan. Reports attributed to the Punjab police spokesperson said that around 600 people had been arrested for violating Section 144 in Punjab. Meanwhile, Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi promised on Sunday to restrict protestors outside Islamabad. Naqvi took an aerial view of Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Attock to review security arrangements in the three cities. He expressed satisfaction with the arrangements. Naqvi stated that necessary measures had been taken to ensure peace and public order in compliance with the IHC's order. He added that police and paramilitary Frontier Corps (FC) and Rangers were diligently performing their duties. The government had taken all possible measures to protect the lives and property of the citizens and that strict action would be taken against "miscreants" in accordance with the law, the interior minister emphasised. headline: Prize bond schedule for December 2024: Dates for upcoming Rs25,000 draw and results
content:
PK Rs25,000 prize bond draw offers Rs30 million grand prize and other rewards for winners. Pakistan's prize bond scheme, managed by the Central Directorate of National Savings (CDNS) under the State Bank of Pakistan, remains a popular savings and investment option for millions. The Rs25,000 prize bond draw, which has been a regular feature since the 1960s, offers both security and liquidity to investors across the country. The next draw for the Rs25,000 prize bond is set for December 10, 2024, at the National Savings Centre in Quetta.  Photo: NATIONAL SAVINGS This draw will feature several attractive prizes, including a grand prize of Rs30 million. Other prizes include five Rs10 million awards and 700 prizes of Rs300,000 each. Prize bonds have long been considered one of the safest forms of investment in Pakistan, providing investors with peace of mind and a guaranteed return in the form of the quarterly draws. The funds raised through the prize bond program also support government revenue generation while encouraging citizens to save money.  Earlier, This upcoming prize bond draw follows the recent Rs 100 prize bond draw (Draw No. 48), which took place on November 15, 2024, in Multan. In this draw, the first prize of Rs 700,000 went to bond number 633542. Meanwhile three second prizes of Rs 200,000 each were awarded to the bond numbers 589006, 881670, and 163958. headline: IShowSpeed sparring with UFC star Dan Hooker highlights mismatch in cage at City Kickboxing
content:
PL IShowSpeed's sparring match with UFC veteran Dan Hooker at City Kickboxing left the streamer humbled in New Zealand. IShowSpeed‚Äôs adventurous 2024 streaming tour took a bruising turn in New Zealand when he stepped into the cage with UFC veteran Dan Hooker. Known for his bold personality, the streamer visited City Kickboxing, the renowned gym that has produced MMA superstars like Israel Adesanya and Kai Kara-France, but quickly learned the price of challenging an elite fighter. Walking into the gym with his signature confidence, Speed greeted trainers and up-and-coming athletes, declaring, ‚ÄúNobody in here can beat me at boxing.‚Äù After a brief sparring session with an amateur, which left him momentarily shaken, Speed adjusted the rules to better suit his strengths. However, his bravado was tested further when Dan Hooker, a 10-year UFC veteran with 24 wins, entered the cage. Speed, cautious about the UFC star‚Äôs capabilities, insisted, ‚ÄúNo kicking‚Ä¶ Let‚Äôs do boxing.‚Äù What followed was a spectacle of endurance and humility. Speed tried to keep his distance, circling the edges of the octagon, but moments of hesitation allowed Hooker to capitalize. The Hangman dropped the streamer multiple times, laughing as he said, ‚ÄúWelcome to my world, brother.‚Äù When Speed protested about a weight difference, Hooker quipped, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm lighter than you,‚Äù highlighting the uphill battle Speed faced. Clips of the match, including one where Speed was left clutching his ribs, quickly went viral, with fans praising his courage and laughing at his antics. After the match, Speed admitted, ‚ÄúHe got me good‚Ä¶ I could tell you were going easy on me.‚Äù Hooker returned the compliment on Instagram, calling Speed ‚Äúballs of steel.‚Äù While his UFC dreams may be out of reach, Speed‚Äôs resilience and charisma hint at a promising future in the influencer boxing realm. headline: Drake calls Steve Lacy a 'fragile opp' during xQc stream, ties it to Kendrick Lamar feud
content:
US ‚ÄúThis guy‚Äôs like a fragile opp, but this is a good song though,‚Äù Drake says, fueling online debate. During a recent livestream with popular streamer xQc, Drake raised eyebrows with his comments about Steve Lacy, calling him a "fragile opp" while acknowledging his music. As Lacy's tracks played in the background, Drake remarked, ‚ÄúThis guy‚Äôs like a fragile opp, but this is a good song though,‚Äù a statement fans quickly linked to Lacy‚Äôs association with Kendrick Lamar. Steve Lacy‚Äôs collaboration with Lamar on tracks like Not Like Us and his presence at Lamar‚Äôs The Pop Out- Ken & Friends concert earlier this year solidified his alliance with the rapper. Their bond is rooted in shared Compton origins, with Lacy openly expressing pride in his hometown and supporting Lamar during his high-profile feud with Drake. A post shared by Shifting Culture (@shiftingculture) Drake‚Äôs comments come amid a backdrop of tension with Kendrick Lamar, who recently released his surprise album GNX. The album, including tracks like Not Like Us and Euphoria, continued to take shots at Drake. Responding to Kendrick‚Äôs diss tracks during the stream, Drake said, ‚ÄúYou need facts to take me out. Fairytales won‚Äôt do it.‚Äù Fans have taken to social media to dissect the remarks, with some viewing them as a playful jab and others interpreting a deeper rivalry. Steve Lacy‚Äôs collaboration on Kendrick‚Äôs PRIDE and his active support for the rapper further fuel speculation about his role in the ongoing feud between the two musical powerhouses. While Drake remains one of the most dominant artists in hip-hop, his remarks during the xQc stream have reignited discussions about alliances and rivalries in the music industry. headline: JonBen√©t Ramsey case revisited: Netflix docuseries sparks new hope for justice
content:
US Nearly three decades after JonBen√©t Ramsey‚Äôs tragic murder, her family renews calls for advanced DNA testing. The murder of 6-year-old pageant queen JonBen√©t Ramsey in December 1996 remains unsolved, but her family continues to seek justice. Netflix‚Äôs upcoming docuseries,Cold Case: Who Killed JonBen√©t Ramsey, premiering on Nov. 25, has reignited public interest in the case. In an exclusive interview with PEOPLE, JonBen√©t‚Äôs father, John Ramsey, criticized the Boulder Police Department for delaying advanced DNA testing on evidence found at the crime scene, including the garrote used in her strangulation. JonBen√©t‚Äôs parents, John and the late Patsy Ramsey, and her siblings, Burke and John Andrew Ramsey, were initially scrutinized but later cleared of involvement after DNA evidence linked an unknown male to the crime. Despite this, the case remains open. ‚ÄúIf it stays in the hands of the Boulder Police, it will not be solved,‚Äù John Ramsey stated, urging authorities to engage cutting-edge DNA technology. As the anniversary of JonBen√©t‚Äôs murder approaches, her family remains hopeful that modern forensic advancements could finally identify her killer. The Netflix docuseries explores the enduring mystery and sheds light on the challenges of resolving one of America‚Äôs most infamous cold cases. headline: Lindsay Lohan‚Äôs $300K plastic surgery transformation: expert breaks down her new look
content:
US Fans were quick to praise her transformation on social media: "She looks amazing. I wish I had $200-$300K." Lindsay Lohan, 38, has been making waves with her radiant and youthful appearance, sparking speculation about a major transformation. Aesthetics expert Dr. Jonny Betteridge claims the star may have spent up to $300,000 on various cosmetic procedures to achieve her stunning new look. Dr. Betteridge, founder of JB Aesthetics in London, shared his analysis in an Instagram video, listing potential enhancements including a facelift, upper eyelid surgery, a nose job, and a surgical brow lift. ‚ÄúShe most likely had some degree of surgical facelift done via an endoscopic approach, meaning it was minimally invasive,‚Äù he explained. Additional treatments allegedly include botox, lip fillers, a lip lift, and veneers, paired with laser resurfacing and a dermatologist-led skincare routine. Fans were quick to praise her transformation on social media. ‚ÄúShe looks amazing. I wish I had $200-$300K,‚Äù one user commented, while another said, ‚ÄúIncredible work! She looks fantastic.‚Äù A post shared by Dr Jonny Betteridge (@drjb.aesthetics) Lohan has attributed her refreshed glow to skincare. In an interview with Allure, the actress revealed her low-maintenance routine, including Av√®ne moisturizers, Peter Thomas Roth eye patches, and occasional laser treatments. ‚ÄúI just want to look at myself and love myself for who I am,‚Äù she shared. The actress, who has faced personal and legal challenges in the past, is now making a celebrated comeback. Her appearance at Paris Fashion Week in a black sequin dress was hailed as ‚Äúan iconic comeback‚Äù by style commentators.¬†Lohan is currently promoting her new Christmas movie, Our Little Secret, set to release on November 27. headline: Rebel Wilson loses bid to dismiss defamation lawsuit in ‚ÄòThe Deb‚Äô dispute
content:
US Rebel Wilson faces a lawsuit over allegations of embezzlement and harassment during the production of The Deb. Rebel Wilson's attempt to dismiss a defamation lawsuit filed by the producers of her directorial debut,The Deb, has been denied by a Los Angeles Superior Court. Judge Thomas Long ruled that the actress‚Äôs claims of sexual harassment and embezzlement, made in an Instagram video and other contexts, do not qualify as protected free speech under California‚Äôs anti-SLAPP statute. The producers, Amanda Ghost, Gregor Cameron, and Vince Holden, allege that Wilson defamed them to gain creative control and force the film's premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). Wilson had previously accused the producers of inappropriate behavior toward the film‚Äôs lead actress and embezzling approximately AU $900,000 from the budget. However, lead actress Charlotte MacInnes denied these allegations, stating in court that Wilson‚Äôs claims were baseless and made her feel bullied by the director. While Wilson countersued in October, alleging theft, bullying, and harassment by the producers, her legal team plans to appeal the recent ruling. Camille Vasquez, attorney for the producers, commended the court‚Äôs decision, calling Wilson‚Äôs dismissal motion a ‚Äúcynical attempt‚Äù to suppress valid legal claims. headline: Jon Watts cancels Wolfs sequel after trust issues with Apple TV
content:
US Jon Watts canceled Wolfs sequel, citing Apple's surprise decision to shift from wide theatrical release to streaming. Jon Watts has revealed he scrapped plans for a sequel to Wolfs, starring George Clooney and Brad Pitt, citing a loss of trust in Apple. The director explained that the studio‚Äôs last-minute decision to shift the original film from a wide theatrical release to a limited run followed by streaming led to his decision. Watts shared with Deadline that Apple initially praised his final cut of Wolfs and even commissioned a sequel. However, he was blindsided by the pivot to streaming, learning of the change less than a week before the public announcement. ‚ÄúApple didn‚Äôt cancel the sequel‚ÄîI did‚Äîbecause I no longer trusted them as a creative partner,‚Äù Watts stated. Despite his disappointment, he returned the sequel commission to avoid generating negative press during the film‚Äôs release. Watts also expressed frustration with Apple for ignoring his request to exclude the sequel announcement from their press release. ‚ÄúThey used it to create a positive spin on their streaming decision,‚Äù he said, emphasizing that the move came without explanation or discussion. While proud of Wolfs, Watts felt compelled to take a stand for creative transparency. His experience echoes a growing trend in the industry, exemplified by Doug Liman‚Äôs Road House debacle after Amazon acquired MGM. Liman, who had anticipated a theatrical release, saw the project shifted to streaming, which directly affected compensation for him and his team. ‚ÄúWe need streaming, but agreements must be honored,‚Äù Liman said in an interview. While Watts supports streaming as a medium, his experience highlights tensions between creative expectations and shifting studio priorities. Apple has yet to comment on the matter, but Watts‚Äô principled decision underscores the importance of trust in creative partnerships. headline: Jon M. Chu provides update on ‚ÄòCrazy Rich Asians‚Äô sequel and upcoming Broadway musical
content:
US Jon M. Chu reveals challenges delaying the Crazy Rich Asians sequel, while teasing a Broadway musical adaptation. Fans eagerly awaiting theCrazy Rich Asianssequel may need to hold out longer as director Jon M. Chu shared new insights into the project‚Äôs delays. In an interview withDeadline, Chu emphasized the need for the follow-up to match the high expectations set by the 2018 hit. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no way I‚Äôm dragging the audience back. The bar is too high,‚Äù he said, noting that attempts to adapt the second book from Kevin Kwan‚Äôs trilogy have yet to meet the creative standards established by the first film. Chu explained that the sequel faces unique challenges as the first movie deviated significantly from the book's plot. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve tried different versions, but we just haven‚Äôt gotten there,‚Äù he shared. While fans may not see the second movie anytime soon, Chu teased a new development‚ÄîaCrazy Rich AsiansBroadway musical, which he will direct, marking his debut in theater. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs very exciting and very fun,‚Äù Chu said, offering hope for fans who wish to revisit theCrazy Rich Asiansuniverse. In addition to the stage adaptation, aCrazy Rich Asiansspinoff film is also in development, focusing on Astrid Leong (Gemma Chan) and her rekindled romance with Charlie Wu (Harry Shum Jr.). headline: Glen Powell hosts lookalike contest in Austin with unique prize for winner's family member
content:
PK Glen Powell‚Äôs Austin lookalike contest featured a creative twist: a movie cameo for the winner's parent or relative. Glen Powell‚Äôs lookalike contest in Austin, Texas, on November 24, was as creative as the actor himself. The winner didn‚Äôt just receive bragging rights but was promised a cameo for their parent or family member in Powell‚Äôs upcoming film‚Äîa prize as unique as the event. Held at Auditorium Shores in Town Lake, the contest drew dozens of Powell‚Äôs lookalikes, but the actor couldn‚Äôt attend in person due to filming commitments in England for The Running Man. Despite his absence, Powell made his presence felt through a Facetime appearance, where he delivered a humorous video message packed with jokes and playful remarks. In his lighthearted video, Powell quipped that the contest was actually for This Is Us actor Justin Hartley‚Äôs lookalike and teased attendees about forming a ‚Äúcriminal Glen-Terprise‚Äù heist. ‚ÄúAnd we don‚Äôt need masks because we all have the same face: It‚Äôs the perfect crime,‚Äù he joked. He also challenged participants to fully commit to the bit, saying, ‚ÄúIf no one is shirtless for no reason, then this whole thing is a sham.‚Äù While his mother and aunt assisted in judging the contest, Powell ensured the highlight was his promise to the winner. He cheekily valued the prize at ‚Äú$6 billion,‚Äù adding, ‚ÄúThe winner‚Äôs parent or family member will have a cameo in my next movie.‚Äù Celebrity lookalike contests have grown in popularity, with similar events held for stars like Timoth√©e Chalamet and Harry Styles. However, Powell‚Äôs mix of humor and a quirky, heartfelt prize sets his event apart, showcasing his creative approach to engaging with fans‚Äîeven from thousands of miles away. headline: Diddy smiles and blows kisses to family during court bail hearing
content:
US Diddy appeared optimistic at a New York City bail hearing as he sought release amid sex trafficking charges. Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs appeared upbeat as he entered a New York City courtroom for a bail hearing, hoping to secure his release while facing charges of sex trafficking and racketeering. The 55-year-old music mogul greeted his family with blown kisses and waves as he entered South Manhattan Federal Court, wearing a beige prison jumpsuit. Unlike previous hearings, he was not shackled and was escorted by US marshals. Family and supporters, including his mother Janice Combs, daughter Chance Combs, son Justin Dior Combs, and adopted son Quincy Brown, attended the hearing on Friday afternoon. The judge deferred the decision on granting him bail, following arguments from prosecutors that Combs could not be ‚Äútrusted‚Äù to follow conditions and might evade legal supervision even with his lawyers‚Äô guidance. Combs is currently detained on a $50 million bond at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York, as he awaits his trial. During the hearing, Combs‚Äô legal team pointed to changed circumstances, including new evidence, as reasons to release him, arguing it would allow him to better prepare for his trial scheduled for May 5. Previously, two judges have ruled that he poses a danger to the community and is a flight risk. Assistant US Attorney Christine Slavik stated that Combs‚Äô attempts to contact witnesses from prison, often through family members, demonstrated that he ‚Äúcannot and will not follow rules‚Äù set by his own legal team. ‚ÄúSimply put, the defendant cannot be trusted,‚Äù she said. Slavik further accused Combs‚Äô lawyers of ‚Äúenabling his flouting of rules‚Äù and argued that they had shown an ‚Äúinability to control their client.‚Äù Last week, prosecutors alleged that Combs used jailmates‚Äô phones to intimidate potential witnesses ahead of his trial. According to court documents, he allegedly contacted family members from prison, asking them to reach out to potential victims and craft ‚Äúnarratives‚Äù while making ‚Äúrelentless efforts‚Äù to ‚Äúcorruptly influence witness testimony.‚Äù COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: PTI convoys face tear gas as march towards Islamabad continues
content:
US PTI Chairman Barrister Gohar says talks are underway. PTI convoys led by Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (K-P) Chief Minister Ali Amin Gandapur and Opposition leader, Omar Ayub, entered Punjab premises on the call of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf founder Imran Khan. The convoys, originating from the Hazara Interchange, are heading towards D-Chowk in Islamabad. As the convoys advanced, they encountered heavy resistance from the police at the Ghazi Brotha Bridge, where intense shelling was reported. Despite the police crackdown, Omar Ayub's convoy managed to push back Punjab Police forces at the Hazara Interchange. Ali Amin Gandapur, who is leading the Hazara Division convoy, played a crucial role in helping the convoy break through the police barricades. After overcoming the police blockade, the convoys continued their journey, with vehicles stretching over two kilometers as they moved forward. On the Hazara Motorway, PTI supporters successfully forced police to retreat, with reports of violent clashes and heavy stone-pelting. Several police personnel were injured in the scuffles, and two officers were severely wounded and transferred to hospitals. Among the injured officers were DSPs Chaudhry Zulfiqar and Shahid Gilani, as well as ASI Tabassum. DSP Zulfiqar suffered significant injuries to his back and legs during the confrontation. 'Talks underway' Barrister Gohar Khan and Saif held a 90-minute meeting with Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan in Adiala Jail, Rawalpindi. Following the meeting, Barrister Gohar described the discussion as significant, confirming that Imran Khan‚Äôs call for a protest remains final and that rumors about it being canceled were untrue. Speaking to journalists after the meeting, Barrister Gohar emphasised that the PTI founder‚Äôs stance on the protest was unchanged, and the movement would proceed as planned. The meeting focused on strategic discussions regarding the ongoing political situation and the party's future course of action. When asked about the ongoing negotiations surrounding the protest, Barrister Gohar assured reporters that updates would be provided in due course. He further confirmed that discussions were still ongoing but did not offer further details at this time. 'Final call' The PTI gave its final call for the protest to meet its four demands: release of all political prisoners, including Imran Khan, reversal of the 26th Constitutional Amendment, restoration of democracy and Constitution in the country and return of allegedly "stolen mandate". The demands surfaced on November 13 after Imran had urged people via a post on X, formerly Twitter, to reach Islamabad and not to return until those were met. The PTI had said that its rallies would be converted into a sit-in in the federal capital and end only when the demands were met. Since then, the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N)-led government, backed by a recent order of the Islamabad High Court (IHC), has been stating that neither the protestors would be allowed to enter the capital nor any leniency would be shown to them this time around. In anticipation of a possible head-on collision between the authorities and the protesters and in view of the visit by Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko, the government decided to place containers to block all the main arteries leading to Islamabad. The blockade has brought the twin cities as well as several other cities in Punjab to a standstill. A surprising decision was the sudden beginning of the repair work on different motorways. Besides, the government also shut down the internet in several areas. Internet services suspension The interior ministry had already announced a day ago that WiFi and mobile internet services would be suspended in areas with "security concerns" but it would remain operational in the rest of the country. Nevertheless, internet tracking monitor Netblocks said WhatsApp backends were restricted in Pakistan. The decision was part of the government's strategy to block communication ahead of the planned protests. Amid this, both sides remained steadfast, refusing to back down until achieving their objectives. Before the march began, the federal and Punjab governments imposed Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC)¬óa legal measure enabling district administrations to ban public gatherings temporarily and denied PTI permission to hold the protest. Nevertheless, PTI took to the streets, with Gandapur leading the march from the party's stronghold in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa, joined by the provincial leadership, workers, supporters, and Imran Khan's wife, Bushra Bibi. Though the caravans had entered Punjab, they were unlikely to reach Islamabad by Sunday night. In a brief address to workers in Swabi, Gandapur urged them to press forward and not retreat until Imran Khan's release, calling on protesters to use all their strength to clear the path to the federal capital. As the PTI convoy reached the Punjab boundary, the police started shelling on them at the Attock Bridge, Chach interchange and Ghazi Barotha canal areas. Later, Gandapur directed the convoy to stop at Ghazi Maqam for a while, urging the workers to get ready, because there was a "battle ahead". Meanwhile, it was reported that Imran Khan's wife, Bushra Bibi, also addressed the workers and asked them to quickly move ahead in their vehicles instead of walking along the march, stressing they would have to move fast and shouldn't come back without bringing Imran Khan back. While the K-P saw the largest mobilisation of the participants, the rallies also set out from various parts of Punjab, Sindh, and Balochistan. In Punjab, opposition supporters marched from cities, including Lahore, Rawalpindi, Gujranwala, Sialkot, Mianwali, Kasur, Okara, and Vehari, among others. Despite heavy police and Rangers' deployment, many PTI workers managed to breach barricades and evade restrictions, in an attempt to reach the capital. Throughout the day, the PTI workers and LEA officials kept clashing in different parts of Punjab. Several leaders arrested A media report suggested that several PTI leaders, including PTI's chief whip in the National Assembly Amir Dogar and Zain Qureshi were arrested from Multan. Reports attributed to the Punjab police spokesperson said that around 600 people had been arrested for violating Section 144 in Punjab. Meanwhile, Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi promised on Sunday to restrict protestors outside Islamabad. Naqvi took an aerial view of Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Attock to review security arrangements in the three cities. He expressed satisfaction with the arrangements. Naqvi stated that necessary measures had been taken to ensure peace and public order in compliance with the IHC's order. He added that police and paramilitary Frontier Corps (FC) and Rangers were diligently performing their duties. The government had taken all possible measures to protect the lives and property of the citizens and that strict action would be taken against "miscreants" in accordance with the law, the interior minister emphasised. headline: Prize bond schedule for December 2024: Dates for upcoming Rs25,000 draw and results
content:
US Rs25,000 prize bond draw offers Rs30 million grand prize and other rewards for winners. Pakistan's prize bond scheme, managed by the Central Directorate of National Savings (CDNS) under the State Bank of Pakistan, remains a popular savings and investment option for millions. The Rs25,000 prize bond draw, which has been a regular feature since the 1960s, offers both security and liquidity to investors across the country. The next draw for the Rs25,000 prize bond is set for December 10, 2024, at the National Savings Centre in Quetta.  Photo: NATIONAL SAVINGS This draw will feature several attractive prizes, including a grand prize of Rs30 million. Other prizes include five Rs10 million awards and 700 prizes of Rs300,000 each. Prize bonds have long been considered one of the safest forms of investment in Pakistan, providing investors with peace of mind and a guaranteed return in the form of the quarterly draws. The funds raised through the prize bond program also support government revenue generation while encouraging citizens to save money.  Earlier, This upcoming prize bond draw follows the recent Rs 100 prize bond draw (Draw No. 48), which took place on November 15, 2024, in Multan. In this draw, the first prize of Rs 700,000 went to bond number 633542. Meanwhile three second prizes of Rs 200,000 each were awarded to the bond numbers 589006, 881670, and 163958. headline: IShowSpeed sparring with UFC star Dan Hooker highlights mismatch in cage at City Kickboxing
content:
PL IShowSpeed's sparring match with UFC veteran Dan Hooker at City Kickboxing left the streamer humbled in New Zealand. IShowSpeed‚Äôs adventurous 2024 streaming tour took a bruising turn in New Zealand when he stepped into the cage with UFC veteran Dan Hooker. Known for his bold personality, the streamer visited City Kickboxing, the renowned gym that has produced MMA superstars like Israel Adesanya and Kai Kara-France, but quickly learned the price of challenging an elite fighter. Walking into the gym with his signature confidence, Speed greeted trainers and up-and-coming athletes, declaring, ‚ÄúNobody in here can beat me at boxing.‚Äù After a brief sparring session with an amateur, which left him momentarily shaken, Speed adjusted the rules to better suit his strengths. However, his bravado was tested further when Dan Hooker, a 10-year UFC veteran with 24 wins, entered the cage. Speed, cautious about the UFC star‚Äôs capabilities, insisted, ‚ÄúNo kicking‚Ä¶ Let‚Äôs do boxing.‚Äù What followed was a spectacle of endurance and humility. Speed tried to keep his distance, circling the edges of the octagon, but moments of hesitation allowed Hooker to capitalize. The Hangman dropped the streamer multiple times, laughing as he said, ‚ÄúWelcome to my world, brother.‚Äù When Speed protested about a weight difference, Hooker quipped, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm lighter than you,‚Äù highlighting the uphill battle Speed faced. Clips of the match, including one where Speed was left clutching his ribs, quickly went viral, with fans praising his courage and laughing at his antics. After the match, Speed admitted, ‚ÄúHe got me good‚Ä¶ I could tell you were going easy on me.‚Äù Hooker returned the compliment on Instagram, calling Speed ‚Äúballs of steel.‚Äù While his UFC dreams may be out of reach, Speed‚Äôs resilience and charisma hint at a promising future in the influencer boxing realm. headline: Everything is Magical in 'Wicked', Even the Fashion!
content: Costume designer Paul Tazewell weaved his magic for ‚ÄòWicked,‚Äô here's how he breathed life into the costume design. When it comes to the world ofWicked, the costumes are just as magical as the story itself. Costume designer Paul Tazewell, known for his meticulous attention to detail, has crafted costumes that not only define the characters of Elphaba and Glinda but also contribute to the world-building of Oz. His journey into the world ofWickedwas shaped by a French picture book, which inspired him to create a visual world where every scene is as captivating as the last, down to the smallest details. Tazewell‚Äôs designs breathe life into the characters, giving depth and backstory through the clothes they wear.  Tracy Nguyen for The New York Times Elphaba‚Äôs earth-toned, textured wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs glamorous, show-stopping dresses aren‚Äôt just about fabric‚Äîthey‚Äôre about storytelling. From the iconic pink bubble dress, a design requiring 137 pattern pieces and over 200 hours of hand-beading, to the intricately felted details of Elphaba's costume, every stitch is a part of a bigger narrative. Paul Tazewell brings more than three decades of experience in costume design, with accolades ranging from Broadway hits likeHamiltonandIn the Heightsto his film work onHarrietandWest Side Story. But it was his approach toWickedthat allowed him to blend his deep love of detail with a fresh, modern interpretation.  Paul Tazewell has spent more than 30 years designing costumes for theater. Image: Instyle Tazewell wanted the costumes to speak to a more expansive, reimagined version of the world of Oz, one that still felt grounded in its theatrical history but also distinctly his own. His meticulous work not only pays homage to the original Broadway costumes designed by Susan Hilferty but also reinterprets them to suit the needs of the film, ensuring the costumes fit perfectly into the cinematic version of this beloved tale. His work with the color palettes of Elphaba‚Äôs darker, nature-inspired wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs lighter, airy look shows the evolution of their characters and their relationship. As Elphaba begins to find herself and grow more comfortable with her own power, her clothes shift from restrictive, turn-of-the-century shapes to more modern, freeing silhouettes.  Cynthia Erivo's costumes as Elphaba featured textural elements that were inspired by nature. Image: Universal Glinda‚Äôs journey also plays out through her fashion‚Äîher early, overly feminine looks evolve as her bond with Elphaba deepens, resulting in a blending of both characters' visual identities.  The bodice of Glinda's (played by Ariana Grande) bubble gown took 225 hours to hand-bead. Image: Universal Tazewell‚Äôs passion for detail extends beyond just the characters. The costumes, made by an extensive team of artisans, serve as an immersive experience that captures every nuance ofWicked's world. With over 60 costumes per lead character and a total of 140 crew members working across eight different workshops, Tazewell's vision comes to life in ways that are both stunning and intricate. His ability to weave the characters' emotional arcs into their clothing and his understanding of how the designs would resonate with the audience is what makes his work so remarkable.  The costumes for Madame Morrible (Michelle Yeoh) featured magical iconography. Image: Universal The film‚Äôs approach toWickedisn‚Äôt about just re-creating past designs; it‚Äôs about evolving them into something new while retaining the magic that has made the characters so iconic. The challenge of blending the theatrical elements with the expansive world of film is one Tazewell embraces with confidence, bringing his creative vision to the forefront in a way that enhances the storytelling. Ultimately, Tazewell's work onWickedis about more than just creating beautiful costumes‚Äîit's about ensuring that every detail, from fabric to silhouette, adds to the narrative, bringing each character‚Äôs journey to life in the most magical way possible. The world of Oz feels alive through Tazewell‚Äôs designs, and it's a testament to his incredible talent and vision that every element ofWicked's costumes adds depth to the story. The world ofWickedfeels vast and boundless. The teamwork between Tazewell, Chu, Crowley, and everyone involved has brought to life something incredibly detailed, imaginative, rich, and exciting‚Äîso much so that you‚Äôll wish it could slow down, allowing you to fully appreciate every intricate detail, from the background characters to Jonathan Bailey‚Äôs Fiyero boots. Exactly as Tazewell envisioned. A post shared by Wicked Movie (@wickedmovie)  COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: SZA and Lizzo gossip about Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during stream, internet reacts: "this is skit lol"
content:
CN SZA and Lizzo‚Äôs comments on Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during a stream sparked a wave of reactions online. On Saturday, November 23, pop stars Lizzo and SZA appeared on Kai Cenat's stream during the streamer's ongoing 24/7 Mafiathon 2 event. While the two were in the kitchen, SZA commented that Cenat seemed like a "clean person." Lizzo agreed but quickly joked that Cenat hadn't "washed his balls" in a long time. SZA, surprised by the remark, asked if it was true and wanted to know if Cenat had told Lizzo. The Juice singer explained that Cenat had been showering with his trunks on for 23 days on stream but suggested that perhaps he was still washing properly. SZA exclaimed: "His meat's been dry for 23 days? Unbelievable!" Social media users reacted strongly to the pair‚Äôs comments. Some felt that SZA and Lizzo were overreacting, with one user on X stating: "Cut the extra money of overactingü§£" Others thought the duo was fully aware they were being filmed. One user on X wrote:"ain't no way they didn't know it has camera, this is skit lol." Another added: "They definitely knew they was on camera üò©üò©." A different user joked: "SZA immediately asking 'who said that' like yes get to the bottom of it, girl üò≠üò≠üò≠." Some fans were unhappy with how Lizzo and SZA spoke about Cenat. One user commented:"Someone let you into his house and you criticize him behind his back.. That‚Äôs foul." Another added: "Really behind his backüò≠." A netizen noted: "Even druski said he‚Äôs bedroom smells like spoiled milk lmao ü§£." Another wrote: "IK HE DIRTY ASF LMAOOOOO." On Friday, November 22, Kai Cenat achieved a major milestone by reaching 500,000 concurrent Twitch subscribers. The 24/7 Mafiathon 2 stream aimed to reclaim his original record of 326,000 subscribers, which was previously broken by Vtuber Ironmouse. By the 22nd day of his marathon stream, he had completely shattered the record. COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. For more information, please see ourComments FAQ Fans were quick to praise her transformation on social media: "She looks amazing. I wish I had $200-$300K." The teamwork between Tazewell, Chu, Crowley, and everyone involved has brought to life something incredibly detailed, imaginative, rich, and exciting‚Äîso much so that you‚Äôll wish it could slow down, allowing you to fully appreciate every intricate detail, from the background characters to Jonathan Bailey‚Äôs Fiyero boots. headline: SZA and Lizzo gossip about Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during stream, internet reacts: "this is skit lol"
content:
CN SZA and Lizzo‚Äôs comments on Kai Cenat‚Äôs hygiene during a stream sparked a wave of reactions online. On Saturday, November 23, pop stars Lizzo and SZA appeared on Kai Cenat's stream during the streamer's ongoing 24/7 Mafiathon 2 event. While the two were in the kitchen, SZA commented that Cenat seemed like a "clean person." Lizzo agreed but quickly joked that Cenat hadn't "washed his balls" in a long time. SZA, surprised by the remark, asked if it was true and wanted to know if Cenat had told Lizzo. The Juice singer explained that Cenat had been showering with his trunks on for 23 days on stream but suggested that perhaps he was still washing properly. SZA exclaimed: "His meat's been dry for 23 days? Unbelievable!" Social media users reacted strongly to the pair‚Äôs comments. Some felt that SZA and Lizzo were overreacting, with one user on X stating: "Cut the extra money of overactingü§£" Others thought the duo was fully aware they were being filmed. One user on X wrote:"ain't no way they didn't know it has camera, this is skit lol." Another added: "They definitely knew they was on camera üò©üò©." A different user joked: "SZA immediately asking 'who said that' like yes get to the bottom of it, girl üò≠üò≠üò≠." Some fans were unhappy with how Lizzo and SZA spoke about Cenat. One user commented:"Someone let you into his house and you criticize him behind his back.. That‚Äôs foul." Another added: "Really behind his backüò≠." A netizen noted: "Even druski said he‚Äôs bedroom smells like spoiled milk lmao ü§£." Another wrote: "IK HE DIRTY ASF LMAOOOOO." On Friday, November 22, Kai Cenat achieved a major milestone by reaching 500,000 concurrent Twitch subscribers. The 24/7 Mafiathon 2 stream aimed to reclaim his original record of 326,000 subscribers, which was previously broken by Vtuber Ironmouse. headline: Everything is Magical in 'Wicked', Even the Fashion!
content: Costume designer Paul Tazewell weaved his magic for ‚ÄòWicked,‚Äô here's how he breathed life into the costume design. When it comes to the world ofWicked, the costumes are just as magical as the story itself. Costume designer Paul Tazewell, known for his meticulous attention to detail, has crafted costumes that not only define the characters of Elphaba and Glinda but also contribute to the world-building of Oz. His journey into the world ofWickedwas shaped by a French picture book, which inspired him to create a visual world where every scene is as captivating as the last, down to the smallest details. Tazewell‚Äôs designs breathe life into the characters, giving depth and backstory through the clothes they wear.  Tracy Nguyen for The New York Times Elphaba‚Äôs earth-toned, textured wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs glamorous, show-stopping dresses aren‚Äôt just about fabric‚Äîthey‚Äôre about storytelling. From the iconic pink bubble dress, a design requiring 137 pattern pieces and over 200 hours of hand-beading, to the intricately felted details of Elphaba's costume, every stitch is a part of a bigger narrative. Paul Tazewell brings more than three decades of experience in costume design, with accolades ranging from Broadway hits likeHamiltonandIn the Heightsto his film work onHarrietandWest Side Story. But it was his approach toWickedthat allowed him to blend his deep love of detail with a fresh, modern interpretation.  Paul Tazewell has spent more than 30 years designing costumes for theater. Image: Instyle Tazewell wanted the costumes to speak to a more expansive, reimagined version of the world of Oz, one that still felt grounded in its theatrical history but also distinctly his own. His meticulous work not only pays homage to the original Broadway costumes designed by Susan Hilferty but also reinterprets them to suit the needs of the film, ensuring the costumes fit perfectly into the cinematic version of this beloved tale. His work with the color palettes of Elphaba‚Äôs darker, nature-inspired wardrobe and Glinda‚Äôs lighter, airy look shows the evolution of their characters and their relationship. As Elphaba begins to find herself and grow more comfortable with her own power, her clothes shift from restrictive, turn-of-the-century shapes to more modern, freeing silhouettes.  Cynthia Erivo's costumes as Elphaba featured textural elements that were inspired by nature. Image: Universal Glinda‚Äôs journey also plays out through her fashion‚Äîher early, overly feminine looks evolve as her bond with Elphaba deepens, resulting in a blending of both characters' visual identities.  The bodice of Glinda's (played by Ariana Grande) bubble gown took 225 hours to hand-bead. Image: Universal Tazewell‚Äôs passion for detail extends beyond just the characters. The costumes, made by an extensive team of artisans, serve as an immersive experience that captures every nuance ofWicked's world. With over 60 costumes per lead character and a total of 140 crew members working across eight different workshops, Tazewell's vision comes to life in ways that are both stunning and intricate. His ability to weave the characters' emotional arcs into their clothing and his understanding of how the designs would resonate with the audience is what makes his work so remarkable.  The costumes for Madame Morrible (Michelle Yeoh) featured magical iconography. Image: Universal The film‚Äôs approach toWickedisn‚Äôt about just re-creating past designs; it‚Äôs about evolving them into something new while retaining the magic that has made the characters so iconic. The challenge of blending the theatrical elements with the expansive world of film is one Tazewell embraces with confidence, bringing his creative vision to the forefront in a way that enhances the storytelling. Ultimately, Tazewell's work onWickedis about more than just creating beautiful costumes‚Äîit's about ensuring that every detail, from fabric to silhouette, adds to the narrative, bringing each character‚Äôs journey to life in the most magical way possible. The world of Oz feels alive through Tazewell‚Äôs designs, and it's a testament to his incredible talent and vision that every element ofWicked's costumes adds depth to the story. The world ofWickedfeels vast and boundless. The teamwork between Tazewell, Chu, Crowley, and everyone involved has brought to life something incredibly detailed, imaginative, rich, and exciting‚Äîso much so that you‚Äôll wish it could slow down, allowing you to fully appreciate every intricate detail, from the background characters to Jonathan Bailey‚Äôs Fiyero boots. Exactly as Tazewell envisioned. A post shared by Wicked Movie (@wickedmovie)  COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. headline: Jeff Wittek sues David Dobrik for $10M after $90K eye surgery from dangerous YouTube stunt
content:
US Dobrik has denied full responsibility, that the stunt was Wittek‚Äôs idea an he asked Dobrik not to disclose this fact. YouTuber Jeff Wittek has revealed undergoing a $90,000 eye surgery to address lingering injuries from a 2020 stunt involving fellow YouTuber David Dobrik. The incident occurred during a video shoot where Wittek was swung from an excavator operated by Dobrik. The stunt took a disastrous turn, leaving Wittek with extensive injuries, including a shattered skull, broken foot and hip, torn ligament, and nearly losing his eye. The stunt, filmed for Dobrik‚Äôs now-deleted vlog, showed Wittek holding onto a rope tied to the excavator arm. As the machine spun faster, he lost control and collided with the metal arm, eventually plunging into the water below. Reflecting on the aftermath, Wittek shared, ‚ÄúYesterday, Dr. Leif Rogers and his team of avengers did a massive five-hour surgery‚Ä¶ to hopefully fix my double vision.‚Äù¬†He added, ‚ÄúThanks for all the kind words and support‚Ä¶ I already feel like I can run through a brick wall.‚Äù A post shared by Jeff Wittek (@jeff) Wittek disclosed that he covered the $90,000 surgery out-of-pocket, as Dobrik has allegedly failed to pay any damages. Despite the expense, Wittek said, ‚ÄúIt was worth every penny.‚Äù However, the incident has now escalated into a legal battle. Wittek is suing Dobrik for $10 million, alleging negligence and intentional harm. According to the lawsuit, Dobrik‚Äôs reckless operation of the excavator caused Wittek‚Äôs life-altering injuries. Dobrik has denied full responsibility, claiming that the stunt was Wittek‚Äôs idea and that he had asked Dobrik not to disclose this fact. On his podcast in 2022, Dobrik stated, ‚ÄúHe got hurt because I was driving. That‚Äôs it, and I f***ing know that‚Ä¶ That‚Äôll be the biggest regret of my life.‚Äù This controversy has added to Dobrik‚Äôs troubled public image, which includes allegations of facilitating unsafe environments during his videos. Wittek has also voiced discontent over Dobrik‚Äôs recent lucrative deal with Snapchat, tweeting, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre paying a guy that smashed my skull in for a prank and left me with lifelong injuries.‚Äù The lawsuit seeks compensation for Wittek‚Äôs mounting medical expenses and loss of income. The fallout from the incident highlights ongoing debates about accountability and safety in the high-stakes world of content creation.
